See stars such as Chris Robshaw at the world cup in September
England is hosting this autumn's Rugby World Cup, so fans are well placed to enjoy some fantastic sport.
The tournament kicks off on September 18, lasts for six weeks and will be held at 12 venues across England and Wales.
There will be 15 free-to-enter 'fanzones' open on and around match days at each venue location, and a couple of extra ones in London.
As the country ignites with rugbymania, there are plenty of special events on offer, too.
On October 2, Newcastle Falcons are staging a special Legends Game at Kingston Park, featuring some of the sport's biggest names, including England hero Jonny Wilkinson.
Tickets cost from £10 for adults ( newcastlefalcons.co.uk ).
At Sandy Park in Exeter, you can enjoy a two-course meal while watching England's Pool A and any subsequent knockout games on a big screen for £30pp or £250 for a table of ten.
Or book to watch eight matches for £200pp ( heartofdevon.com ).
Organised by England Rugby 2015 and the Rugby Football Union, a Festival of Rugby will run countrywide until October 31 – visit festivalofrugby2015.com for information on events.

He ran out of countries! Meet the traveller who visited... And you can tour Twickenham, home of English rugby, at any time. It includes the dressing rooms, royal box, players' tunnel and entry to the World Rugby Museum. Adults cost £20 ( englandrugby.com/twickenham ).
And don't panic if you want to see England captain Chris Robshaw in the flesh, but don't have tickets yet.
England Rugby Travel (0844 788 5000) still has ticket-inclusive travel packages available for key games.
